ygData.messageBody:
*couch* *sputter* end of argument..
----- Original Message -----
From: Grant Vanderhule <vandergm@...>
To: <shadowknight@onelist.com>
Sent: Saturday, May 15, 1999 4:43 PM
Subject: [shadowknight] ht vs loh again


> From: Grant Vanderhule <vandergm@...>
>
> actually, i talked to a guy who said that loh could only heal like 600 hp
at
> max.. of course, i dont have a paladin char, so somebody else has to
confirm
> or deny that.
>
> also, not all of our spells suck compared to paladin spells. please note
> that paladins have NO ranged damage-dealing attacks whatsoever, except
> against undead. they have no general nukes, no DOTs, they cant even use
> archery. which makes it a bit odd that they can root.. hmm. anyway, while
> they DO have an annoying array of effective spells, a shadowknight can
> easily take down a paladin if they play a game of keep-away (and resist
> those annoying blind spells). in other words, use of shadow step combined
> with archery and our lovely clinging darkness series of spells will
royally
> mess up a paladin. and since they have no ability to detect invis, imagine
> fights once you get hide.. shadow step, hide, and shoot them in the back
> once they turn around while looking. its right out of the movies :)
>
> yes, many of our damage dealing spells do kind of suck for our level. but
> who needs meganukes when you can dish out 70 or 80 damage a combat round
> with a BBC? just add the little bits our spells add to that and we are
> already ahead.. just remember to always keep your darkness spells handy
and
> keep siphoning every once in a while. i can see why they took away our
> ability to use banshee aura at lvl 39.. jeez, can you imagine a guy who
can
> nail you for 50-60 damage a hit AND you take damage every time you hit
back?
> we are supposed to be scary, but that is just mean :) so they replace it
> with shieldskin, which is at least a well-needed AC boost for us. and
while
> taking away boil blood as a lvl 49 spell hurts, i can see the reasoning
for
> that too, since we have none of the other blood magic spells. they just
give
> us the best of the darkness series in place of it. doesnt DOT as much hp,
> but it slows em and lasts forever and a day..
>
> and one last advantage: half or more of the sk around are large races,
while
> ALL paladins are medium or small. create a newbie ogre sk, and then a
newbie
> high elf paladin, and the difference in survivability is noticeable. even
a
> newbie barbarian shaman can hold off multiple enemies by himself at lvl 2
or
> 3, demonstrating just how buff the large melee-types would be. while the
> high elf just gets pounded :) also, my guildmaster is a paladin (stop
> LOOKING at me like that!) and he is constantly complaining about how
> worthless he is against anything but undead opponents. just take heart,
and
> if you simply cant survive duels against a paladin of your same level,
take
> some time out, put on a few levels, and perfect your dueling strategy.
trust
> me, you will come out on top ;)
>
> Beld Demonblade
> Fennin Ro
